SEARCH
Package com.example.eventlotterysystemapplication

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlotterysystemapplication.Model.Event
public class Event extends Object
An instance of this object represents a single instance of an event

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Event()
    An empty constructor for the Event class, is used because it makes it easier to parse a document from Firebase and set specific fields to the values extracted from Firebase
    Event(String name, String description, String place, String[] eventTags, String organizerID, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, String registrationStartTime, String registrationEndTime, String invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity)
    This constructor can also allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program, but the main purpose here is to help with testing
    Event(String name, String description, String place, String[] eventTags, String organizerID, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, String registrationStartTime, String registrationEndTime, String invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity, boolean mock)
    This constructor can also allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program, but the main purpose here is to help with mock testing
    Event(String name, String description, String place, ArrayList<String> eventTags, String organizerID, LocalDateTime eventStartTime, LocalDateTime eventEndTime, LocalDateTime registrationStartTime, LocalDateTime registrationEndTime, LocalDateTime invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity)
    A constructor whose main purpose is to allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program itself

    joinCancelledList(User user)
    Allows a user to join the cancelled list, unlike other joins, this one has almost no conditions, as a user can enter the cancelled list from any entrant list, or even from just not being in the registration at all
    void
    joinChosenList(User user)
    Allows the user to join the chosen list, given that they already are in the waiting list, and are not in the cancelled and finalized lists
    void
    joinFinalizedList(User user)
    Allows the user to join the finalized entrant list, given that they are already chosen by the lottery and are in the chosen list
    void

    Allows a user to join the waiting list for the event, given that they are not already a part of this or some other entrant list for this event

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      An empty constructor for the Event class, is used because it makes it easier to parse a document from Firebase and set specific fields to the values extracted from Firebase

    • Event

      @RequiresApi(api=26) public Event(String name, String description, String place, ArrayList<String> eventTags, String organizerID, LocalDateTime eventStartTime, LocalDateTime eventEndTime, LocalDateTime registrationStartTime, LocalDateTime registrationEndTime, LocalDateTime invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity)
      A constructor whose main purpose is to allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program itself
      Parameters:
      name - The event's name
      description - The event's description
      place - The event's location
      eventTags - The event's tags
      organizerID - The ID of the user who organizes the event
      eventStartTime - The start time of the event
      eventEndTime - The ending time of the event
      registrationStartTime - The time when the registration for the event opens
      registrationEndTime - The time when the registration for the event closes
      invitationAcceptanceDeadline - The deadline for accepting the invitation for the event, assuming that you were selected by the lottery
      maxWaitingListCapacity - The maximum capacity of the waiting list
      maxFinalListCapacity - The maximum number of people who can be chosen for the event by the lottery system

    • Event

      @RequiresApi(api=26) public Event(String name, String description, String place, String[] eventTags, String organizerID, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, String registrationStartTime, String registrationEndTime, String invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity)
      This constructor can also allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program, but the main purpose here is to help with testing
      Parameters:
      name - The event's name
      description - The event's description
      place - The event's location
      eventTags - The event's tags
      organizerID - The ID of the user who organizes the event
      eventStartTime - The start time of the event
      eventEndTime - The ending time of the event
      registrationStartTime - The time when the registration for the event opens
      registrationEndTime - The time when the registration for the event closes
      invitationAcceptanceDeadline - The deadline for accepting the invitation for the event, assuming that you were selected by the lottery
      maxWaitingListCapacity - The maximum capacity of the waiting list, or -1 if there's no limit
      maxFinalListCapacity - The maximum number of people who can be chosen for the event by the lottery system

    • Event

      @RequiresApi(api=26) public Event(String name, String description, String place, String[] eventTags, String organizerID, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, String registrationStartTime, String registrationEndTime, String invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity, boolean mock)
      This constructor can also allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program, but the main purpose here is to help with mock testing
      Parameters:
      name - The event's name
      description - The event's description
      place - The event's location
      eventTags - The event's tags
      organizerID - The ID of the user who organizes the event
      eventStartTime - The start time of the event
      eventEndTime - The ending time of the event
      registrationStartTime - The time when the registration for the event opens
      registrationEndTime - The time when the registration for the event closes
      invitationAcceptanceDeadline - The deadline for accepting the invitation for the event, assuming that you were selected by the lottery
      maxWaitingListCapacity - The maximum capacity of the waiting list, or -1 if there's no limit
      maxFinalListCapacity - The maximum number of people who can be chosen for the event by the lottery system

      public void setEntrantList(EntrantList entrantList)
      A setter for the entrant list
      Parameters:
      entrantList - The entrant list object

    • setEntrantListValues

      public void setEntrantListValues(ArrayList<User> entrantListValues, int list) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets a single entrant list, based on the ArrayList that is passed into it and the integer parameter specifying which list to set. 0 means to set waiting list to the input ArrayList, 1 means to set the chosen list, 2 means to set the cancelled list, 3 means to set the finalized list
      Parameters:
      entrantListValues - The ArrayList of users to set one of the entrant lists to
      list - An integer specifying which list you want to set to be equal to the input ArrayList, where: 0: waiting list 1: chosen list 2: cancelled list 3: finalized list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input list is not one of 0, 1, 2, 3

    • addToEntrantList

      public void addToEntrantList(User user, int list) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a user to one of the entrant lists, based on which list is specified in the list argument.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be added to one of the entrant lists
      list - An integer specifying which list you want to set to be equal to the input ArrayList, where: 0: waiting list 1: chosen list 2: cancelled list 3: finalized list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input list is not one of 0, 1, 2, 3

    • removeFromEntrantList

      public void removeFromEntrantList(User user, int list) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deletes a user from one of the entrant lists, based on which list is specified in the list argument.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be deleted from one of the entrant lists
      list - An integer specifying which list you want to set to be equal to the input ArrayList, where: 0: waiting list 1: chosen list 2: cancelled list 3: finalized list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the input list is not one of 0, 1, 2, 3

    • joinWaitingList

      public void joinWaitingList(User user)
      Allows a user to join the waiting list for the event, given that they are not already a part of this or some other entrant list for this event
      Parameters:
      user - The user who wants to join the waiting list for the event

    • leaveWaitingList

      public void leaveWaitingList(User user)
      Allow a user to leave the waiting list for the event, given that they are already in the waiting list for the event
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be removed from the event waiting list

    • joinChosenList

      public void joinChosenList(User user) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Allows the user to join the chosen list, given that they already are in the waiting list, and are not in the cancelled and finalized lists
      Parameters:
      user - The user that is chosen to accept the invitation
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • leaveChosenList

      public void leaveChosenList(User user) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Allows a user to leave the chosen list, given that they are already in the chosen list
      Parameters:
      user - The user who wants to leave the chosen list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • joinCancelledList

      public void joinCancelledList(User user)
      Allows a user to join the cancelled list, unlike other joins, this one has almost no conditions, as a user can enter the cancelled list from any entrant list, or even from just not being in the registration at all
      Parameters:
      user - The user that is to be put into the cancelled list

    • joinFinalizedList

      public void joinFinalizedList(User user)
      Allows the user to join the finalized entrant list, given that they are already chosen by the lottery and are in the chosen list
      Parameters:
      user - The user

    • leaveFinalizedList

      public void leaveFinalizedList(User user)
      Allows the user to leave the finalized list, given that they are already in the list
      Parameters:
      user - The user who wants to leave the finalized list

    • getPosters

      public ArrayList<android.graphics.Bitmap> getPosters()
      A getter for the posters list
      Returns:
      The list of posters, which are bitmap objects in the program

    • setPosters

      public void setPosters(ArrayList<android.graphics.Bitmap> posters)
      A setter for the posters list
      Parameters:
      posters - The list of posters, which are bitmap objects in the program

    • addPoster

      public void addPoster(android.graphics.Bitmap poster)
      Adds a new poster to the posters list
      Parameters:
      poster - The bitmap of the new poster to be added to the event list

    • deletePoster

      public void deletePoster(android.graphics.Bitmap poster)
      Deletes a poster from the posters list
      Parameters:
      poster - The bitmap of the poster to be removed

    • deletePoster

      public void deletePoster(int position)
      Deletes a poster based on its position in the posters ArrayList
      Parameters:
      position - The zero indexed position of the poster to be removed

    • generateQRCode

      public void generateQRCode()
      Using the eventID, and the hardcoded scheme and activity/host, we can create a QR code that, when scanned by a phone with this app installed, will open up the app with the event description page

    • getQRCodeBitmap

      public android.graphics.Bitmap getQRCodeBitmap()
      Returns the QR Code bitmap object, if it hasn't been generated yet then we generate first before returning
      Returns:
      A bitmap object of the QR code image

    • setQRCodeBitmap

      public void setQRCodeBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap QRCodeBitmap)
      Sets the QR code bitmap to a specific bitmap
      Parameters:
      QRCodeBitmap - The bitmap to set the QR code to
